questions.question_text: A small marketing firm uses many SaaS applications that hold sensitive information. The firm has discovered terminated employees are retaining access to systems for many weeks after their end date. Which of the following would BEST resolve the issue of lingering access?

choices.B: Set up a privileged access management tool that can fully manage privileged account access.
choices.D: Configure federated authentication with SSO on cloud provider systems.
choices.A: Perform weekly manual reviews on system access to uncover any issues.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B - This will automatically revoke access for terminated employees and can help to prevent unauthorized access to systems by ex-employees. While the other options could potentially help to improve security, they do not specifically address the issue of terminated employees retaining access to systems

Selected Answer: D
Federation is a process that provides a shared login capability across multiple systems and enterprises. It essentially connects the IAM of multiple systems.

One aspect of federation to consider with configuring it, is that since a third party is handling the transaction, you want to ensure that important tasks or changes are propagated quickly over the network with little delay. The following are some common changes that in a business setting need to happen almost instantaneously.
 • Provisioning: Creating an account and providing user authorization to it
 • Deprovisioning: Removing authorization and disabling the account
 • Password Reset: Resetting a user's account password in the event of a security incident

https://www.examtopics.com/discussions/comptia/view/69490-exam-cs0-002-topic-1-question-263-discussion/

This option would be more effective than the other options listed in addressing the issue of lingering access, as it proactively manages privileged access and can help prevent data breaches resulting from unauthorized access.

A company’s change management team has asked a security analyst to review a potential change to the email server before itis released into production. The analyst reviews the following change request:


Change request date: 2020-01-30 -
Change requester. Cindy Richardson

Change asset: WIN2K-EMAILOOI -
Change requested: Modify the following SPF record to change +all to –all

Which of the following is the MOST likely reason for the change?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
"When an SPF record includes -all (fail qualifier), receiving servers may reject messages from senders that aren't in your SPF record." 

Source: https://support.google.com/a/answer/10683907?hl=en

comments.content: Also agree. Thanks for the explanation.

CompTIA Static Analysis +

Third-party libraries is the keyword here. If you include a third-party library in your project, you can check its code (if it's open source) otherwise you won't have access to perform a static analysis, so in this question that isn't specified which makes me discard the option C due to the lack of context. With a dynamic analysis, you can still identify potential vulnerabilities even if it is open source or not. Going with "B" here.
